results.title: Two little frosts
results.brief_description: An animated story in the style of a folk tale in which man is pitted against the elements. The personified frost creatures assume that an old man will fall easily prey to their ability to freeze. Despite all their efforts, the experienced woodman unknowingly defeats the two little frosts.

results.title: Two languages are better than one
results.creator_credit: Jan Denton, John Moore and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: A bilingual program offers instruction in two languages. Substantial community support is required to successfully establish a bilingual program. This may be forcoming if people are provided with sufficient information upon which to base fruitful discussion. This video provides a starting point for such discussion.

results.title: Two in the bush: the Attic of the world
results.creator_credit: Christopher Parsons and ABC-TV (Australia). Natural History Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Two in the Bush”.
The naturalist, Gerald Durrell, observes Australian wild life. On a sheep farm he sees the problems kangaroos pose for farmers and meets some scientists doing field work on “roos”. He also sees the birth of a kangaroo, and its trip into its mother’s pouch. Research on the breeding biology of animals is also seen.

results.title: Two grasslands: Texas and Iran
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Comparative cultures and geography”
Compares the Edwards Plateau in Texas and the steppes of Iran as regions similar in rainfall pattern and sparsity of vegetation. Explores the lifestyles of the people of the two regions to reveal the interrelationship between land, technology and culture.

results.title: Two farms: Wisconsin, Hungary
results.creator_credit: Richard Kuhne, John H. Secondari, Helen Jean Secondari and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Comparative cultures and geography”
Contrasts farm life in Wisconsin and southeastern Hungary following one family in each rural area through a daily routine. Features members of the families commenting on how their farms operate and what they find satisfying in their lives.

results.title: Two eight bravo
results.creator_credit: James M. Olsson, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Grahame Jennings Productions
results.brief_description: An army recruitment film which captures the drama of battle. A tank hits a land-mine in Vietnam, and we follow the journey of the crippled tank back to Australia where repairs begin. Young Army apprentices, in training, learn how to repair tanks, aircraft and modern equipment.

results.title: Two deserts: Sahara and Sonora
results.creator_credit: Andrew B. Nemes and Audio Visual Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Comparative cultures and geography”
Shows what characteristics the Sahara Desert in Africa and the Sonora Desert in North America have in common, and explains how factors of economics, religion, culture and technology make the regions different.

results.title: Two decades
results.creator_credit: N.V.K. Murty and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: The history of India since the end of British Colonial rule, and the beginning of the end of colonial rule all over the world. Highlights are the passing of great men; the achievement of internal unity in spite of religious and class differences. Five year plans have changed the face of India but much remains to be achieved.
